Articles.Content:
Interesting result, SRV Ron, but unless the challenge specifies otherwise, it's stock parts only.

Jeb is supposed to be return safely. However, he is now lost in space waiting rescue which makes the challenge a failure. Anyhow, stock only was not specified, only the usual cheats can't be used, such as infinite fuel, and you have to fly the rocket yourself.

Edited March 17, 2014 by SRV Ron

Anyhow, stock only was not specified

Check the OP

Default challenge rules say stock only
Looks like OTehNoes is the winner with 20G

-snip-

As deemed by the challenger, you have won! Where is your own challenge?

As deemed by the challenger, you have won! Where is your own challenge?

Ah! Once again the challenger has become the... challengee?

Anyway! My mind is a bit blank at the moment so I'll aim to have the challenge with you within an hour or so!

Ah! Once again the challenger has become the... challengee?

The apprentice has, again, become the master.

If you're stuck for ideas, theres a couple from the original on the first post:

SRBs to space, land with inverted cockpit on the gravel runway, land somewhere using only RCS fuel... zarakon, can you remember any others?

Yeah, I still have my scorekeeping sheet

3 Kerbals on VAB roof via powered landing

Land on the Mun at night using LV-Ns

Orbit using only LV-N

3 Kerbals to the Mun and back, No fuel lines

Cannon that fires a fuel tank

Rocket plane to the gravel runway

Land on another planet with no fuel lines or LV-N engines

Orbit 2 ships, dock, and deorbit using only LV-909, no RCS

EVA from Minmus surface to rendezvous in orbit

Land on something using only Ion thrusters after reaching LKO

Kerbal to orbit without oxidizer

Land on gravel runway without landing gear, fins, or large control surfaces

From LKO to Munar orbit with only RCS

4 Hitchhiker pods to the Mun

Build a rocket-only SSTO, land at KSC

Land a plane on Duna without parachutes or retro-rockets

3-man Gilly landing and return to Kerbin on a Mainsail engine

Land a plane on the gravel runway. In cockpit view. Upside-down.

Crash an ion-powered probe into the Sun.

Vertical ascent to orbit with an air breathing first stage

Mun landing in cockpit view

Wedge a lander in the Moho north pole pit

The two that nobody ever completed were the upside-down plane landing and the moho pit lander

Oooh okay I have an idea. Take off from the KSC and land at the island airfield, with no form of thrust at all. You have to make a super infinigliding girder like mine. This may seem easy but they are by their very nature awkward to fly, it may only have control surfaces to deal with yaw and pitch, roll can only done by the pitch in a probe body at the front of the... thing....

This may seem easy but these things by their very nature are awkward to fly as pitch adjustments often cause them to speed up, so the challenge is down to finesse.

End condition is landed and stopped on the island runway, that is when your run ends and you record the time.

Initial time to beat: 1 minute 38 seconds (it is stopped in the last image, it just fell over a bit, causing the 0.3 m/s)

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited March 19, 2014 by OTehNoes
These "best in 24 hours" things aren't how this is supposed to work

Check the OP

Default challenge rules say stock only

While now too late, this all stock got 43.7G on vertical reentry. The other post was for acceleration at burnout with the mod booster. Vertical decouplers used to keep this from blowing up from overheating during powered flight.

Edit, note, only the stack decoupler functioned. The vertical ones did not fire off.

Edited March 19, 2014 by SRV Ron
But then how do we declare a winner? Shall we just do first to beat my time?
It's supposed to just be the first person who replicates your stunt
Ah I see, well, I'll update the original then!

Thankyou zarakon, I was trying not to make too much of a big deal out of the 24 hour thing, but yes: it's whomever replicates the feat first.

And OhTehNoes: That one's a doozy!

Thankyou zarakon, I was trying not to make too much of a big deal out of the 24 hour thing, but yes: it's whomever replicates the feat first.

And OhTehNoes: That one's a doozy!

You should update the first post to make that clearer. The challenge this thing is based upon is probably familiar to only a minority of the world where baseball is one of the most popular sports. But it seemed like the 24h window was quie a success on the minimus speed challenge.

Edited March 19, 2014 by cyberklad

You should update the first post to make that clearer. The baseball challenge this thing is based upon is probably familiar to only a minority of the world where baseball is one of the most popular sports. But it seemed like the 24h window was quie a success on the minimus speed challenge.

I know it as a skateboarding thing :S

I am open to suggestions as to how to reword, i thought it was pretty clear

Also: I'm going to be overseas for a few weeks shortly, so you might need to manage the challenges yourselves for a little while.

Edited March 19, 2014 by kahlzun

If you beat a challenge, post your own! You have 24 hours from completing the challenge to post your own, or it will default to the next to complete and so on.

If noone has beaten your challenge within 7 days, you have the right to submit a new one, or nominate a new challenger to submit their own!

Perhaps you can add something like: The first person to best the challenger wins the challenge and can then post thir own challenge. Instead of If you beat a challenge, post your own

Perhaps you can add something like: The first person to best the challenger wins the challenge and can then post thir own challenge. Instead of If you beat a challenge, post your own

I see where you mean. Updated.
It doesn't look like anyone likes infinigliders.

It doesn't look like anyone likes infinigliders.

Well, I still don't quite understand the rules here but I've been trying to follow along. You guys are just too fast for me.

Since nobody else has tried yet, here's an infiniglider to the island. It certainly doesn't beat the time though. Although it's unclear to me if it's supposed to be faster, or just get there...
OhTehNoes, are you happy with Claw's entry? Your post was a bit grey-area about whether the challenge was time-limited or not..

The challenge is no longer limited by the 24 hours, but seeing as he didn't beat my time, it isn't a winner! Game on chaps!

The key is to make it light as possible, you'll find if you pitch up and down aggressively, it'll accelerate VERY fast. If you guys really struggle that much to make one though I'll give you my craft file.

Edited March 20, 2014 by OTehNoes

I did this a looong time ago for the pizza tryouts:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Since I won't be able to make up a challenge for a little about 8 hours, I'll let someone else think of one unless you guys like waiting.

SpaceK531 entry looks good and if he is giving permistion for others to make up a chalange how about:

Distance using only RCS.

Monopropellant Only.

No liquid fuel.

No solids.

No Ion.

Electric charge and wheels are fine.

Unmaned is fine.

I dont think you can make orbit but if you can then we will use altitude. Other wise distace from start point.

To stop Infinite gliders no Control surfaces can be used. You may use a part with a control surface but only if its locked before take off.

Best distace after 24 hours.

Still doesn't beat my challenge...

Claw's entry is the best so far, but he didn't come close to beating my time...
